articles.headline: Supreme Court Divided on Sales Taxes for Online Purchases
articles.snippet: The justices heard arguments about whether to overrule a 1992 decision that shielded many internet retailers from having to collect sales taxes.
articles.abstract: The justices heard arguments about whether to overrule a 1992 decision that shielded many internet retailers from having to collect sales taxes.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A closely divided Supreme Court struggled on Tuesday to decide whether internet retailers should have to collect sales taxes in states where they have no physical presence.

articles.headline: Sanctions Flap Erupts Into Open Conflict Between Haley and White House
articles.snippet: A top White House official said Nikki Haley experienced “momentary confusion” by announcing new sanctions on Russia. “I don’t get confused,” she replied.
articles.abstract: A top White House official said Nikki Haley experienced “momentary confusion” by announcing new sanctions on Russia. “I don’t get confused,” she replied.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump was watching television on Sunday when he saw Nikki R. Haley, his ambassador to the United Nations, announce that he would impose fresh sanctions on Russia. The president grew angry, according to an official informed about the moment. As far as he was concerned, he had decided no such thing.
articles.byline: By Peter Baker, Julie Hirschfeld Davis and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: Inside Cambridge Analytica’s Virtual Currency Plans
articles.snippet: The data firm was hoping to do its own so-called initial coin offering and quietly helped promote other companies in the unregulated industry.
articles.abstract: The data firm was hoping to do its own so-called initial coin offering and quietly helped promote other companies in the unregulated industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — The embattled political data firm Cambridge Analytica quietly sought to develop its own virtual currency in recent months through a so-called initial coin offering, a novel fund-raising method that has come under growing scrutiny by financial regulators around the world.
articles.byline: By Nathaniel Popper and Nicholas Confessore

articles.headline: Barbara Bush, Wife of 41st President and Mother of 43rd, Dies at 92
articles.snippet: Mrs. Bush avoided controversial issues while in the White House and became known for her straight talk, lack of pretension and self-deprecating humor.
articles.abstract: Mrs. Bush avoided controversial issues while in the White House and became known for her straight talk, lack of pretension and self-deprecating humor.
articles.lead_paragraph: Barbara Bush, the widely admired wife of one president and the fiercely loyal mother of another, died on Tuesday at her home in Houston. She was 92.

articles.headline: Mike Pompeo, C.I.A. Director, Met With Kim Jong-un in North Korea
articles.snippet: The president alluded to the mission on Tuesday when he said that the United States was in direct talks with North Korea at “extremely high levels.”
articles.abstract: The president alluded to the mission on Tuesday when he said that the United States was in direct talks with North Korea at “extremely high levels.”
articles.lead_paragraph: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla. — President Trump dispatched the C.I.A. director Mike Pompeo to North Korea to meet with its leader, Kim Jong-un, in recent weeks to lay the groundwork for a summit meeting between Mr. Kim and Mr. Trump, two people briefed on the secret trip said on Tuesday.
articles.byline: By Mark Landler and Matthew Rosenberg

articles.headline: Huawei and ZTE Hit Hard as U.S. Moves Against Chinese Tech Firms
articles.snippet: The U.S. and China are threatening a global trade war as they look to protect their most advanced industries.
articles.abstract: The U.S. and China are threatening a global trade war as they look to protect their most advanced industries.
articles.lead_paragraph: The United States undercut China’s technology ambitions on Tuesday, advancing a new rule that would limit the ability of Chinese telecommunications companies to sell their products in this country.
articles.byline: By Raymond Zhong, Paul Mozur and Jack Nicas

articles.headline: If North Korea Talks Are Not Fruitful, ‘I Will Respectfully Leave,’ Trump Says
articles.snippet: As the momentum grows for a meeting with the North Korean leader, President Trump acknowledged that it was a risky undertaking, and one that could still end in failure.
articles.abstract: As the momentum grows for a meeting with the North Korean leader, President Trump acknowledged that it was a risky undertaking, and one that could still end in failure.
articles.lead_paragraph: PALM BEACH, Fla. — President Trump declared on Wednesday that he would scrap a planned summit meeting with North Korea’s leader, Kim Jong-un, or even walk out of the session while it was underway, if his diplomatic overture was not heading toward success.
